keyTakeAways: A former New York prison guard, Robert Brooks, died after being repeatedly beaten while in handcuffs at Marcy Correctional Facility on December 9, 2024.
David Kingsley was found guilty of murder and first-degree manslaughter; Mathew Galliher and Nicholas Kieffer were acquitted of murder charges.
The body-camera footage, though silent, showed guards punching, stomping, and lifting Brooks by the neck, revealing a chilling lack of concern and contributing to the prosecution’s case.
The prosecution claimed all guards acted as a gang, showing a collective depraved indifference to human life, which is central to murder charges.
Kieffer pepper sprayed Brooks, Galliher attached shackles, and Kingsley lifted him by the neck — actions detailed in both video and testimony.
Six of the 10 guards indicted were charged with murder; five previously pleaded guilty to manslaughter, one to a misdemeanor charge of attempted tampering with evidence.
William Fitzpatrick, as special prosecutor, took over due to Attorney General Letitia James’s recusal to avoid conflicts of interest.
Fitzpatrick is also prosecuting the fatal beating of Messiah Nantwi at Mid-State Correctional Facility in March 2025, indicating a broader pattern of prison violence and accountability efforts.
Three more guards have agreed to plead guilty to reduced charges and are cooperating with prosecutors, showing potential shifts in institutional accountability.

summaryOfNewsArticle: A former New York prison guard, David Kingsley, was found guilty of murder and first-degree manslaughter in the death of inmate Robert Brooks, who was beaten multiple times upon arrival at Marcy Correctional Facility on December 9, 2024. The incident, captured on silent body-camera footage, showed guards inflicting severe injuries, including a fatal beating in the infirmary, and prompted widespread public outrage. While Kingsley was convicted, guards Mathew Galliher and Nicholas Kieffer were acquitted of murder charges despite being involved in physical actions such as pepper spraying and attaching shackles. The prosecution claimed all guards acted as a gang with a depraved indifference to life, a key element in murder charges. William Fitzpatrick, the special prosecutor, took over due to Attorney General Letitia James’s recusal, and is also prosecuting a separate case involving the death of inmate Messiah Nantwi at Mid-State Correctional Facility. Several other guards have pleaded guilty to reduced charges or are cooperating with prosecutors, indicating a broader pattern of accountability efforts in New York’s correctional system.
title: Former New York state prison guard found guilty in death of inmate beaten, 2 others acquitted
